title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.15.31 | 17-12-2022
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.key_quote: Om Namo Bhagavate Vasudevaya Narayanam Namaskritya
segments.summary: The lecture begins with traditional Vaishnava prayers and mantras.

segments.key_quote: This is Suta Goswami describing the position of Arjuna.
segments.summary: The speaker introduces the verse from Srimad Bhagavatam and explains that Arjuna's state was not one of ordinary lamentation but of transcendence due to his spiritual assets.

segments.key_quote: Doubts of duality begin from the misconception of the material body which is accepted as a self by less intelligent persons
segments.summary: The speaker elaborates on the concept of duality arising from the misidentification of the material body as the self, drawing from Srila Prabhupada's purport.

segments.key_quote: The most foolish part of our ignorance is our identifying with this material body as the self.
segments.summary: The speaker continues to explain how the false identification with the body leads to attachment to material possessions and relationships, creating an ocean of misconceptions.

segments.key_quote: By assimilating the instructions of the Bhagavad Gita one is sure to be released from such bewilderment because real knowledge is knowledge that the Supreme Personality of Godhead Vasudeva or Lord Krishna is everything
segments.summary: The speaker explains that everyone is bewildered by the concept of 'mine' and that the remedy is to assimilate the teachings of Bhagavad Gita and understand that Krishna is everything.
The speaker explains that everything is Krishna's energy and part and parcel of Him, emphasizing the concept of non-duality and how perfect knowledge eradicates the illusion of ownership.

segments.key_quote: So, therefore, the instructions of the Bhagavad Gita eradicate all kinds of material conceptions.
segments.summary: The speaker uses the example of Arjuna to illustrate how the teachings of the Bhagavad Gita can eradicate material conceptions, such as grief over the death of a father, by understanding the eternal nature of the soul.

segments.key_quote: Krishna is always present in the form of his instructions.
segments.summary: The speaker emphasizes that Krishna is always present through his instructions, form, pastimes, and qualities, and that a devotee never feels his absence due to his transcendental presence in different non-dual energies.

segments.key_quote: The spirit soul has got spiritual identity, which is eternal.
segments.summary: The speaker contrasts the temporary material form with the eternal spiritual identity of the soul, emphasizing the soul's eternal relationship with Krishna.

segments.key_quote: One can see Him, one can feel His presence, even in this present life, simply by understanding the Advayagyana Lord, or the Absolute Lord, through the process of devotional service.
segments.summary: The speaker concludes by stating that one can constantly be in association with the Lord through devotional service, especially by hearing and chanting Krishna's name, which allows Krishna to reveal Himself within the heart.
